childnodes.sy: This week Laura teams up with Guy Turland of "Day Tripper" for the cutest collaboration of all time. Guy shows Laura how to make a raw Coconut Chili Slice (or "cake" if you don't speak Australian).
Woah! Laura broke out of the studio and hit the streets in our extra special NOT LIVE season finale. Come along for the ride in our first-ever California road trip.
Need a little inspiration for the Raw Vegan Valentine in your life? Laura's got a lip-smackin' lolli you're all gonna love.
It's pizza time! This all-veggie, guilt-free masterpiece is the perfect thing for that movie night you've been wanting to have.
Does a dairy-free, grain-free pasta dish sound impossible? It's not! Laura's got another raw, vegan trick up her sleeve guaranteed to impress at your next dinner party.
Grab a seat, Laura's making breakfast. These groats, with a bonus apple crumble and cream, are a great alternative to those humdrum smoothies and can be served warm during cold winter months.
Laura and Jimmy Wong talk movies and make some healthy, delicious alternatives to the gross stuff you often find at movie theaters.
This beautiful raw, vegan cheesecake is appropriate for all kinds of gatherings.
Stumped as to what you can do with winter vegetables? Well, Laura Miller's got a few awesome ideas for you.
What's better than rich, fudgy chocolate brownies? How bout rich, fudgy chocolate brownies topped with chocolate ganache? And did we mention they're Raw and Vegan?
Stressed about what to bring to this year's holiday party? This week Laura whips up 3 easy and delicious dips that are bound to impress your pickiest party-goers.
This week Laura gets her hands dirty showing us how to make some homemade sauerkraut.
This pasta ain't your nona's recipe - but it's also way better for you. Add in some amazing sauce and raw vegan "meatballs" and you've got yourself a meal. Buon Appetito!
This week Laura hosts a very special guest in her spoooky Halloween Special...
childnodes.t: Spooky Halloween Special ft. Vegan Black Metal Chef

childnodes.sy: Welcome to Season 2! This week Laura Miller makes soft serve -- no dairy, no nuts, no fancy ice cream contraption... you're gonna go bananas for this.
One of Laura's Recipes with only a few ingredients? Crazy, right. Good thing these guys are delicious.
Do you have a surplus of walnuts? Do you love using seasonal fruit? Then this is the raw tart for you.
Are these the same thing you'll find at a fast food joint? No way. Are they better for you though? Without a doubt. Plus, they're a ton of fun to make.
Laura prepares the perfect dish to bring to a party - they probably won't even know it's vegan.
Green shakes come in many flavors, but the key is that they are all packed with nutrients that help your day get off to a great start. This week, Laura shows how to make a Blackberry Green Shake.
Yup, vegans get a summer as well. So why not try this tasty ice cream ... if for no other reason than using a hatchet on a coconut.
While they aren't authentic, these tacos are a tasty and healthy alternative for those who don't dig on the carne asada.

You can buy tomatoes at all times of the year, but there's really nothing like a ripe Summer tomato. With that in mind, Laura shows you how to make a delicious, savory tomato tart. Spoiler: it's delicious.
The chocolate truffles we all know and love are pretty bad for us - no one will argue that. So this week, Laura's making raw truffles that not only taste great, but are packed with nutrients as well.

Laura Miller shows you how to make an amazing chocolate pudding with an unlikely ingredient: avocados. The flavor and texture alone should get you to make this - but add in how nutritious it is for you and there's no reason not to try this out!
Raw. Vegan. Not Gross, hosted by Laura Miller, a chef with a mission to make Raw, Vegan food approachable and great-tasting. This week, she's showing you how to make Kale Chips.
